p: The center for nursing classification and clinical effectiveness, at the University of Iowa, is well‐known for publishing several books linking the nursing interventions classification (NIC) and the nursing outcomes classification (NOC) to nursing diagnoses developed by NANDA‐I (Johnson et al., 2006, 2012; Johnson, Bulechek, Dochterman, Maas, & Moorhead, 2001). Research focused on previous linkage work provided a valid and reliable methodology for this work. More recently a publication focused on nutrition diagnoses (Mantovani, Moorhead, & Abe, 2020) adopted a new structure for the linkages based on changes in the format of nursing diagnoses published in the most recent edition of NANDA‐I (Herdman & Kamitsuru, 2018). This project focused on using the new diagnosis format adopted by the NANDA‐I.
